title: Australian Values and Democratic Beliefs
desc: Freedom, equality, respect and democratic principles you must understand for the citizenship test.

title: The Australian System of Government
desc: How Australia is governed: constitutional monarchy, federal system and separation of powers.

title: The Australian Constitution and the Rule of Law
desc: The highest law in Australia and how it guarantees equality before the law.

title: The Role of the Prime Minister, Ministers and Parliament
desc: Who leads Australia, how parliament works, and how laws are made.

title: Voting in Australia: Rights and Responsibilities
desc: Compulsory voting, enrolment, secret ballots, elections and referendums.

title: Australian History: From Indigenous Cultures to Federation
desc: Key historical events from the first Australians to Federation in 1901.

title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples
desc: The first peoples of Australia, their cultures, connection to land and ongoing significance.

title: Australian Citizenship: Rights, Responsibilities and the Pledge
desc: What citizenship means, what citizens can do, and what is expected of them.

title: Life in Australia: Laws, Services and Everyday Rules
desc: Everyday life in Australia: laws, healthcare, education, work and social expectations.

title: Australian Symbols, National Days and Traditions
desc: The flag, coat of arms, national anthem, Australia Day, ANZAC Day and traditions.
